intro: Scandix longistylis, commonly known as the long-styled scandix, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Scandix longistylis is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to thrive in partial shade. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
